title: New Approach to Phonon and Magnon Angle-Resolved EELS and EEGS Simulations Including the Effect of Multiple Scattering
content: Phonons and Magnons, fundamental excitations in solid-state systems, play pivotal roles in various technological applications. Phonons are essential for understanding heat flow at the nanoscale, while Magnons hold promise for memory storage devices. Leveraging the high spatial resolution offered by Scanning Transmission Electron Microscopy (STEM) to study these excitations has emerged as a crucial and timely endeavor [1-3].
